Package: com.github.amkay.gradle.gitflow.version

[Groovy] Class NearestVersionLocator

    • com.github.amkay.gradle.gitflow.version.NearestVersionLocator

    • Locates the nearest Tags whose names can be parsed as com.github.zafarkhaja.semver.Versions. Both the absolute nearest version tag and the nearest "normal version" tag are included.

      Primarily used as part of version inference to determine the previous version.

        • static final String DEFAULT_PREFIX_VERSION

          The default value of the config value of CONFIG_VERSION_TAG. This is used if the respective sections are missing in .git/config, e.g. if You are not using a Gitflow plugin for Git.

      • Method Detail

        • @SuppressWarnings('AbcMetric') NearestVersion locate(Grgit grgit)

          Locate the nearest version in the given repository starting from the current HEAD.

          All tag names are parsed to determine if they are valid version strings. Tag names can begin with DEFAULT_PREFIX_VERSION (which will be stripped off).

          The nearest tag is determined by getting a commit log between the tag and HEAD. The version tag with the smallest log from a pure count of commits will have its version returned. If two version tags have a log of the same size, the versions will be compared to find the one with the highest precedence according to semver rules. For example, 1.0.0 has higher precedence than 1.0.0-rc.2. For tags with logs of the same size and versions of the same precedence it is undefined which will be returned.

          Two versions will be returned: the "any" version and the "normal" version. "Any" is the absolute nearest tagged version. "Normal" is the nearest tagged version that does not include a pre-release segment.

          Parameters:
          grgit - the repository to locate the tag in
          fromRevStr - the revision to consider current. Defaults to HEAD.
          Returns:
          the version corresponding to the nearest tag
